ygData.messageBody:
>From: Andrew Whiteside <andrew668@...>
>
>Well I'm a new smith too but i know how to start. At first spend at least
>10
>points in it, then sharpen til about 20 or so, then make scalers, then
>skewers for a while til skill is around 100, then you can make simple
>banded
>stuff and some harder ones. You can make them earlier but your success rate
>will be low so wait, then when banded stuff is trivial try harder stuff,
>70pp should be good to start, I wish i had that much, I only got around 25,
>30pp.
>
>
>Level 13 Barbarian Warrior,
>Bristlebane server

70 P is a good start, but not nearly enough to get you to skill lvl 80
(where it starts becoming profitable enough to pay for itself, or least so I
hear; I'm a skill lvl 43 blacksmith right now). Although making scalers can
increase your skill, I'd highly recommend making lanterns until lvl 80.
They're cheaper, you'll have more successes with them, and you can sell them
back to merchants for about half of what it cost you to buy the components.
